title: Transfer Rater: Oxlade-Chamberlain to Everton, Obiang to Liverpool
text:
Transfer Rater: Oxlade-Chamberlain to Everton, Obiang to Liverpool The latest transfer rumours from around the world. 
Things change in the blink of an eye in football. The Football Whispers Index takes the latest transfer rumours and gives them a score out of five; the higher the score, the more realistic and reliable the whisper. 
Here are today's top five emerging whispers for the summer. And keep an eye on Transfer Talk for the latest gossip. 
Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain to Everton 
Arsenal's versatile midfielder Oxlade-Chamberlain is a summer target for Everton, according to the Daily Mirror. 
The 23-year-old will be entering into the final year of his contract next season, and the England international has admitted previously that he may need to look at his options as he is not currently a regular starter in Arsene Wenger's side. 
Toffees boss Ronald Koeman is an admirer of the former Southampton man, and it is thought the Everton hierarchy will give their Dutch manager a significant transfer budget in the summer to help them challenge for a Champions League spot next year. 
Manchester City are rivalling the Merseyside club for Oxlade-Chamberlain's signature, with Pep Guardiola a fan of the player since seeing him in action against his Bayern Munich side in 2014. 
Pedro Obiang to Liverpool 
Jurgen Klopp will turn to West Ham United midfielder Obiang in an attempt to shore up a defence that has let him down at times this season, The Sun reports. 
The Hammers are hoping to extend Obiang's current deal, but the Sun report claims that £18 million could be enough to lure the Spaniard away from the London Stadium. 
The 24-year-old has been impressive in the last few months as Slaven Bilic's side have recovered from a poor start to the season. 
Danilo Pereira to Arsenal 
Arsenal have been scouting Porto's midfielder Danilo Pereira, A Bola is reporting. 
The Portuguese outlet claims that the Gunners had scouts at the Primeira Liga giant's recent 4-2 victory over Rio Ave on Saturday, in which Danilo scored during an impressive performance. 
The 25-year-old has a contract that runs until 2020, but it is thought there is a £34.5m release clause should the Gunners wish to trigger it. 
Jordan Pickford to Manchester City 
As well as battling over Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain, Manchester City and Everton are set to go head-to-head for Sunderland's young goalkeeper Jordan Pickford, according to the Sunday Express. 
Pickford's has three years remaining on his current deal, but the 22 year old has made it clear he wants to be playing in the Premier League next season, according to the Daily Express. 
The England under-21 international has impressed for the Black Cats this season, despite the club propping up the league, and could represent a long-term solution to the City's goalkeeping problems. 
Ryan Sessegnon to Tottenham Hotspur 
Tottenham, Arsenal and Chelsea are involved in a three-way fight for Fulham's 16-year-old full-back Ryan Sessegnon, but Spurs are confident of beating their rivals to his signature, according to the Daily Mail. 
The youngster has made 18 appearances for the Cottagers this season, scoring four goals, and appeared as a substitute during their recent FA Cup meeting with Mauricio Pochettino's side, impressing with his pace and energy. 
The England under-17 international will be free to sign a professional contract when he turns 17 in May, with Liverpool, Manchester City and Bayern Munich also thought to be interested in the player.
